subject: Career
title: Dormant Ties: Reactivating Old Contacts
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dormant Ties: Reactivating Old Contacts.

hook.text: You haven't spoken in five years. Is it weird to reach out? Research says no â€” and it's incredibly valuable.

buildup.text: Daniel Levin's research found dormant ties provide more novel information than current contacts.

discovery.text: Old contacts have moved to new industries, roles, and networks. They bring fresh perspectives.

twist.text: People are flattered to be remembered. 'I was thinking about our work on X' is all you need.

climax.text: Reactivate five dormant ties per quarter. The ROI on these conversations is disproportionately high.

punchline.text: Old connections have new value. Reach out.

quiz.question: What did Daniel Levin's research find about dormant ties?
options: They provide more novel information than current contacts
They are less valuable than new contacts
